Package org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree

Interface Layout<KEY,​VALUE>

  • Type Parameters:
    KEY - type of key
    VALUE - type of value
    All Superinterfaces:
    Comparator<KEY>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CountsLayout, GenericLayout, IdRangeLayout, IndexLayout, IndexStatisticsLayout, Layout.Adapter, TokenScanLayout
    public interface Layout<KEY,​VALUE>
extends Comparator<KEY>
    Main point of interaction for customizing a GBPTree, how its keys and values are represented as bytes and what keys and values contains.

    Additionally custom meta data can be supplied, which will be persisted in GBPTree.

    Rather extend Layout.Adapter as to get standard implementation of e.g. Layout.Adapter.toString().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  Layout.Adapter<KEY,​VALUE>
      Adapter for Layout, which contains convenient standard implementations of some methods.

      • copyKey

        KEY copyKey​(KEY key,
            KEY into)
        Copies contents of key to into.
        Parameters:
        key - key (left unchanged as part of this call) to copy contents from.
        into - key (changed as part of this call) to copy contents into.
        Returns:
        the provided into instance for convenience.

        Returns:
        new value instance.

        Parameters:
        key - for which to give size.
        Returns:
        size, in bytes, of given key.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

              KEY key)
        Writes contents of key into cursor at its current offset.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to write into, at current offset.
        key - key containing data to write.

      • writeValue

        void writeValue​(PageCursor cursor,
                VALUE value)
        Writes contents of value into cursor at its current offset.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to write into, at current offset.
        value - value containing data to write.

      • readKey

        void readKey​(PageCursor cursor,
             KEY into,
             int keySize)
        Reads key contents at cursor at its current offset into key.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to read from, at current offset.
        into - key instances to read into.
        keySize - size of key to read or FIXED_SIZE_KEY if key is fixed size.

      • readValue

        void readValue​(PageCursor cursor,
               VALUE into,
               int valueSize)
        Reads value contents at cursor at its current offset into value.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to read from, at current offset.
        into - value instances to read into.
        valueSize - size of key to read or FIXED_SIZE_VALUE if value is fixed size.

      • fixedSize

        boolean fixedSize()
        Indicate if keys and values are fixed or dynamix size.
        Returns:
        true if keys and values are fixed size, otherwise true.

      • minimalSplitter

        default void minimalSplitter​(KEY left,
                             KEY right,
                             KEY into)
        Find shortest key (best effort) that separate left from right in sort order and initialize into with result.
        Parameters:
        left - key that is less than right
        right - key that is greater than left.
        into - will be initialized with result.

      • identifier

        long identifier()
        Used as verification when loading an index after creation, to verify that the same layout is used, as the one it was initially created with.
        Returns:
        a long acting as an identifier, written in the header of an index.

      • majorVersion

        int majorVersion()
        Returns:
        major version of layout. Will be compared to version written into meta page when opening index.

      • minorVersion

        int minorVersion()
        Returns:
        minor version of layout. Will be compared to version written into meta page when opening index.

      • writeMetaData

        default void writeMetaData​(PageCursor cursor)
        Writes meta data specific to this layout instance to cursor at its current offset.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to write into, at its current offset.

      • readMetaData

        default void readMetaData​(PageCursor cursor)
        Reads meta data specific to this layout instance from cursor at its current offset. The read meta data must also be verified against meta data provided in constructor of this Layout. Constructor-provided meta data can be null to skip this verification. if read meta data doesn't match with the meta data provided in constructor PageCursor.setCursorException(String) should be called with appropriate error message.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to read from, at its current offset.

      • namedIdentifier

        static long namedIdentifier​(String name,
                            int identifier)
        Utility method for generating an identifier(). Generates an 8-byte identifier from a short name plus a 4-byte identifier.
        Parameters:
        name - name to be part of this identifier, must at most be 4 characters.
        identifier - to include into the returned named identifier.
        Returns:
        a long which is a combination of name and identifier.

      • compatibleWith

        boolean compatibleWith​(long layoutIdentifier,
                       int majorVersion,
                       int minorVersion)
        Typically, a layout is compatible with given identifier, major and minor version if
        • layoutIdentifier == this.identifier()
        • majorVersion == this.majorVersion()
        • minorVersion == this.minorVersion()

        When opening a tree to 'use' it, read and write to it, providing a layout with the right compatibility is important because it decides how to read and write entries in the tree.

        Parameters:
        layoutIdentifier - the stored layout identifier we want to check compatibility against.
        majorVersion - the stored major version we want to check compatibility against.
        minorVersion - the stored minor version we want to check compatibility against.
        Returns:
        true if this layout is compatible with combination of identifier, major and minor version, false otherwise.

      • initializeAsLowest

        void initializeAsLowest​(KEY key)
        Initializes the given key to a state where it's lower than any possible key in the tree.
        Parameters:
        key - key to initialize.

      • initializeAsHighest

        void initializeAsHighest​(KEY key)
        Initializes the given key to a state where it's higher than any possible key in the tree.
        Parameters:
        key - key to initialize.
